import turtle
import random


class Circle:
    
    #initialize any values you need for a class, what you want "Circle" to have
    def __init__(self, x, y, r, color, line_width=2):
        self.x = x #on this particular circle, set x value to x value put in
        self.y = y
        self.radius = r
        self.color = color
        self.line_width = line_width
        
    #other methods are for what you want Circle to do
    def draw(self):
        turtle.penup()
        turtle.goto(self.x, self.y)
        turtle.color(self.color)
        turtle.pensize(self.line_width)
        turtle.pendown()
        turtle.circle(self.radius)
        
    #define how you want something to print. How to turn object into string
    def __str__(self):
        return "x = " + str(self.x) + \
               "\ny = " + str(self.y) + \
               "\nr = " + str(self.radius)
               
def main():
    #make 50 randomly colored, randomly located circles
    for i in range(50):
        x = random.randint(-250, 250)
        # x = i * 4
        # y = i * 4
        y = random.randint(-250, 250)
        color = random.choice(["red", "blue", "green", "orange", "purple"])
        c = Circle(x, y, 50, color)
        c.draw()
        
main()
